basics.name: T Tirabassi
basics.label: College Graduate
basics.summary: Bachelors of Arts in Information & Computer Sciences from the University of Hawaii at Manoa.

education.institution: University of Massachusetts Boston, Boston, MA

work.company: University of Hawai'i/Department of Hawaiian Home Lands
highlights: Collaboratively worked on research efforts revolving around the limited economic opportunities and infrastructural connectivity barriers affecting community development for the island of Moloka’i.

Worked with team members to perform community outreach in local Moloka’i communities and create viable solutions to bridge the gap in economic opportunities and digital access present on Moloka’i compared to those of neighboring islands.

The final solution developed was Moloka’i Connect, a digital resource aggregator used to catalogue and network the past and present resources available to the residents of Moloka’i, officially presenting the finished aggregator to the Lieutenant Governor.
Coach kids of various ages through a sports curriculum, including active involvement in games, promoting teamwork and partnership, enhancing communication among peers, and promoting fun.

Assisted students and faculty with technology and university systems across all University of Hawaii locations and local community colleges by promoting and performing University of Hawaii Manoa operations center duties.
Performed culturally choreographed shows for onboard guests
Entertain, teach, and interact with guests in regards to performances
Guide guests through hula lessons and produce welcoming environment
Assisted customers with finding certain items, checking out, and friendly conversation
Worked the floor for security purposes and for customer service needs
Assisted customers with finding certain items, checking out, and friendly conversation
Worked the floor for security purposes and for customer service needs

Activities.summary: The world's largest educational and scientific computing society
Uh Manoa club that focuses on the development of student produced game projects.
